task.title: Manage Volumes
task.shortdesc: Eucalyptus offers persistent storage that you can attach to a running instance. These Eucalyptus block storage (EBS) volumes persist autonomously from the running life of an instance. After you attach a block volume to an instance, you can use it like any other physical hard drive. This screen allows you to view a list of your volumes, create new volumes, attach and detach volumes to a running instance, and delete volumes. You can page through the list of volumes by clicking the navigation buttons at the bottom of the screen.

step.cmd: You can toggle between the table view and the grid view by clicking the appropriate icon next to the View label at the top right of the screen.
Sort the volumes list by selecting a sort order using the Sort by drop-down list box.

task.title: Searching and Filtering the Volumes List

step.cmd: To perform a simple search/filter, type some search text into the search text box at the top right of the page.
For more precise filtering and searching, you can add one or more filters by clicking one of the available filters in the Filter by section on the right side of the page.
Click the Create New Volume button. The Create new volume page will appear.

task.title: Viewing Details of a Volume
task.shortdesc: Several items in the volume list allow you to click on them to see more detailed information.

taskbody.context: To see more details about a volume, or an object associated with an image:

step.cmd: Click the name/ID in the list of volumes to display detailed information about the selected volume.
Click an instance ID to see to see detailed information about the instance associated with the selected volume.
Click the number of snapshots to see a detailed list of all of the snapshots associated with the selected volume.

task.title: Actions
task.shortdesc: Each entry in the image list has a context menu, accessible in the Actions column. Clicking the action icon brings up a menu of actions that you can perform on the selected image.

taskbody.context: The following context menu actions are available:

step.cmd: This item will bring up the volume detail page.
This item brings up a page that allows you to view, add, and delete snapshots for a volume.
This item allows you to attach the volume to a running instance.

info.note: This menu item will not appear if the volume is already attached to an instance.

task.title: Detach a Volume from a Running Instance

step.cmd: This item allows you to detach the volume from a running instance.

info.note: This menu item will not appear if the volume is not attached to an instance.

step.cmd: This item allows you to delete a volume.

info.note: This menu item will not appear if the volume is attached to an instance.
